title: The $1 “Victorian Candles” from Dollar Tree I’m Using for Holiday Dinners
description: Stock up while you can. READ MORE...
author: Ashia Aubourg
text: DecoratingDecor & AccessoriesShoppingAshia AubourgAshia AubourgFrom the moment I started remixing ramen noodles into gourmet meals and spending hours watching cooking shows as a puny six-year-old, I knew I found a deep passion for food. While I realized — after taking on a two-year high school internship in an award-winning kitchen — that a…read morepublished nowWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Credit: JHVEPhoto/ShutterstockThe Victorian era, which originated in the 19th century, boasted an abundance of patterns with unique textures and bold and dark colors, such as navy blues, earthy browns, forest greens, and ruby reds. Recently, Dollar Tree stocked its shelves with the most charming renditions of candles that mimic this period’s style — and while that time was known for being prim and opulent, you’ll be shocked to learn that this home decor find costs less than $1.25. The taper candles feature a twisted shape that mimics an intricately designed rope. They come in four shades: opaque white, forest green, ruby red, and harvest orange. A pack of two 10.5-inch candles costs $1.25. You can find all the hues in stores, but Dollar Tree doesn’t have them available for shipping currently. However, Joann has a similar version available online that is currently on sale.Shoppers cannot stop sharing how much they love these taper candles. One person commented on the post detailing this Dollar Tree find, saying: “Omg!! I’ve been looking for some.” While another fan mentioned, “Ooo, what a good find!”

From the moment I started remixing ramen noodles into gourmet meals and spending hours watching cooking shows as a puny six-year-old, I knew I found a deep passion for food. While I realized — after taking on a two-year high school internship in an award-winning kitchen — that a…read more

published now

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

The Victorian era, which originated in the 19th century, boasted an abundance of patterns with unique textures and bold and dark colors, such as navy blues, earthy browns, forest greens, and ruby reds. Recently, Dollar Tree stocked its shelves with the most charming renditions of candles that mimic this period’s style — and while that time was known for being prim and opulent, you’ll be shocked to learn that this home decor find costs less than $1.25. 

The taper candles feature a twisted shape that mimics an intricately designed rope. They come in four shades: opaque white, forest green, ruby red, and harvest orange. A pack of two 10.5-inch candles costs $1.25. You can find all the hues in stores, but Dollar Tree doesn’t have them available for shipping currently. However, Joann has a similar version available online that is currently on sale.

Shoppers cannot stop sharing how much they love these taper candles. One person commented on the post detailing this Dollar Tree find, saying: “Omg!! I’ve been looking for some.” While another fan mentioned, “Ooo, what a good find!”
